meanings.definition: Regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She keeps idealizing her favorite singer, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: People often enjoy idealizing their vacation destinations before actually visiting them.
meanings.sent3: He was idealizing his cooking skills so much that he burnt the toast.
meanings.sent4: The children were idealizing their superhero costumes, feeling invincible and powerful.
meanings.sent5: The artist was idealizing the landscape, painting it with vibrant colors and perfect symmetry.

meanings.definition: To form an ideal or perfect image of.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys idealizing his dream house, imagining every detail perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Many writers have a habit of idealizing their protagonists, making them flawless.
meanings.sent3: She was idealizing her pet goldfish, believing it could understand her conversations.
meanings.sent4: The photographer was idealizing the model, capturing her beauty in a magical light.
meanings.sent5: The architect was idealizing the new building, designing it with innovative features and elegance.
